headline: Will CFO Luca Zaramella’s Expanded COO Role Reshape Mondelez’s (MDLZ) Cost Discipline and Growth Narrative?
summary: Mondelez International has appointed long-serving Chief Financial Officer Luca Zaramella as Chief Operating Officer effective February 1, 2026, giving him oversight of global commercial operations, sales, marketing, and supply chain while the company searches for a new CFO. This dual CFO-COO role concentrates financial and operational oversight in a single executive, hinting at a tighter link between cost discipline and commercial execution across Mondelez’s four regions. headline: Mondelez Concentrates Finance And Operations As Zaramella Takes Dual Role
summary: Mondelez International (NasdaqGS:MDLZ) has expanded Luca Zaramella’s role to include Chief Operating Officer, alongside his existing position as Chief Financial Officer. This leadership change places both financial oversight and day to day operations under a single executive. The move marks a meaningful shift in how the company organizes its top management responsibilities.
